dataset_info.name: Malaysian Legal RAG Golden Dataset
dataset_info.description: 20 legal questions with ground truth answers for evaluating the Malaysian Legal RAG system

questions.question: What is the definition of 'consideration' under Malaysian contract law?
questions.ground_truth: When at the desire of the promisor, the promisee or any other person has done or abstained from doing, or does or abstains from doing, or promises to do or to abstain from doing, something, such act or abstinence or promise is called a consideration for the promise.

questions.question: What makes an agreement void due to coercion?
questions.ground_truth: Coercion is the committing, or threatening to commit any act forbidden by the Penal Code, or the unlawful detaining or threatening to detain, any property, to the prejudice of any person whatever, with the intention of causing any person to enter into an agreement.

questions.question: What is 'free consent' in contract law?
questions.ground_truth: Consent is said to be free when it is not caused by coercion, undue influence, fraud, misrepresentation, or mistake.

questions.question: When can a contract be specifically enforced?
questions.ground_truth: Specific performance of a contract shall be enforced when the act agreed to be done is such that compensation in money for its non-performance would not afford adequate relief, or when there exists no standard for ascertaining compensation.

questions.question: What are the licensing requirements for housing developers in Malaysia?
questions.ground_truth: No person shall engage in or carry on or undertake or cause to be undertaken a housing development unless he is in possession of a licence issued under this Act.

questions.question: What is 'undue influence' in a contract?
questions.ground_truth: A contract is said to be induced by undue influence where the relations subsisting between the parties are such that one of the parties is in a position to dominate the will of the other and uses that position to obtain an unfair advantage over the other.

questions.question: What is fraud under the Contracts Act?
questions.ground_truth: Fraud includes acts committed with intent to deceive or induce a person to enter into a contract, such as suggestion of fact which is not true, active concealment of fact, promise without intention of performing, or any other act fitted to deceive.

questions.question: When is an agreement void for uncertainty?
questions.ground_truth: Agreements the meaning of which is not certain, or capable of being made certain, are void.

questions.question: What is a Housing Development Account?
questions.ground_truth: Every licensed housing developer shall open and maintain a Housing Development Account with a bank or finance company for each housing development undertaken by the licensed housing developer.

questions.question: Can a contract in restraint of trade be enforced?
questions.ground_truth: Every agreement by which anyone is restrained from exercising a lawful profession, trade, or business of any kind, is to that extent void.

questions.question: What is the penalty for carrying on housing development without a license?
questions.ground_truth: A person who engages in housing development without a licence shall be guilty of an offence and is liable to a fine or imprisonment or both.

questions.question: When can specific performance be refused?
questions.ground_truth: Specific performance of a contract cannot be enforced in favour of a person who has become incapable of performing, or violates, any essential term of the contract.

questions.question: What makes an agreement without consideration valid?
questions.ground_truth: An agreement without consideration is void unless it is in writing and registered, or is a promise to compensate for something done, or is a promise to pay a debt barred by limitation law.

questions.question: What is misrepresentation under contract law?
questions.ground_truth: Misrepresentation includes positive assertion in a manner not warranted by information, any breach of duty which gives advantage to the person committing it by misleading another, or causing a party to make a mistake as to the substance of the thing which is the subject of the agreement.

questions.question: Can a court grant an injunction to prevent breach of contract?
questions.ground_truth: An injunction may be granted to prevent the breach of an obligation existing in favour of the applicant, whether expressly or by implication.

questions.question: What happens if both parties are under a mistake as to a matter of fact?
questions.ground_truth: Where both the parties to an agreement are under a mistake as to a matter of fact essential to the agreement, the agreement is void.

questions.question: What is the Controller's power regarding housing developers?
questions.ground_truth: The Controller may at any time revoke or suspend a licence if the housing developer has failed to comply with any condition of the licence or any provision of this Act.

questions.question: What are wagering agreements?
questions.ground_truth: Agreements by way of wager are void; and no suit shall be brought for recovering anything alleged to be won on any wager.

questions.question: When can rectification of an instrument be granted?
questions.ground_truth: When through fraud or a mutual mistake of the parties, a contract or other instrument in writing does not express their real intention, either party may institute a suit to have the instrument rectified.

questions.question: What is the effect of agreements in restraint of marriage?
questions.ground_truth: Every agreement in restraint of the marriage of any person, other than a minor, is void.
